experience: You and Ashley both know Steve Gershik, Eric Kuhn, and 7 others
As the Chief Marketing Officer for GitLab, I built a team from 1 to 25 people across demand generation, product marketing, developer relations, and design.
Head of Developer Marketing, Google Maps

Joined the Google Maps APIs team after the deprecation of core products to support a team and product transition to be developer focused. As developer marketing lead, worked very closely with product and engineering to launch all products in 2015. Also led the largest initiative of 2015 for the 10 year anniversary of the Google Maps APIs working cross-functionally across marketing, sales, product, engineering, and partnerships.-Created, planned, and launched Code the Road to celebrate 10 years of Google Maps APIs. Code the Road was a one month trip across the United State with 14 stops including Harley-Davidson, Disney, and Sesame Street in a 1959 GM bus. Worked with some of our top partners to hold both developer and consumer events at each stop with thousands of developers engaged in person and 54 million of impression on social media. -Worked with PM and engineering to launch all products and feature updates in 2015 for the Google Maps APIs including the following: Google Maps API on Android Wear, Google Places API for iOS, Google Maps Roads API, Google Places API for Android, Places ID in the Google Geocoding API, and Interactive Data Layers in the JavaScript Maps API.

Facebook acquired Parse in April 2013 after we built our developer audience from 10,000 to 60,000 in 8 months and created an amazing mobile development platform. Post-acquisition I continued to lead Parse marketing with a larger cross-functional team within the Facebook platform team. I also took on new responsibilities spanning more teams in Facebook like helping to organize f8, leading product marketing for AppLinks.org, and helping to bring the Facebook platform message to a broader audience. -Lead the marketing effort to grow our Parse developer audience to around 300,000 developers while launching a steady stream of product updates.-Continued our strong presence in the developer community with flagship events like Parse Developer Day, Mobile Developer Day, and the FbStart event series. Parse Developer Day was our San Francisco user conference with 700 developers from over 15 countries. We launched 4 huge new products and had a full day event with 3 tracks of educational content presented by our Parse engineers. I was the lead on creation, planning, and execution for Parse Developer Day and it was a wonderful event for the Parse community.-Led European initiative to bring Parse to new markets. In the first 6 months of this targeted effort, we saw an increase in customers in Europe of over 30,000. -Created thought leadership content, blog content, and sales enablement content for all pieces of the Parse platform. Lead numerous iterations of the Parse website to better surface content and improve navigation. From the homepage to all the product pages, I was responsible for all content.-In addition to leading Parse while at Facebook, I was a lead on Facebook’s Developer Conference, f8. For f8, I led the f8 website, application and registration for the event, email communication, online marketing, demand generation, and more. We were able to launch 10+ products from the entire Facebook platform to over 2000 developers in attendance.

As the first non-engineering hire at Parse, I was given the task of creating and executing a marketing and sales plan spanning events, inbound marketing, outbound marketing, PR, content, social, partnerships, and tons more. In just over 2 years, we’ve grown the number of apps built on Parse from 10,000 to 300,000 and gained customers like Sesame Street, Home Depot, Armani, and many others. -Created and executed our first marketing and sales strategy, targeted both independent app developers and enterprise developers. -Initiated the event marketing program by taking our event sponsorship and presence from zero to over four  large scale events per month including Apps World, GlueCon, Dreamforce, AWS re:Invent, and more. -Created all event collateral, booth backdrops, content for talks and panels, and negotiated all sponsorships and attendance.-Instituted our partnership program with companies like MailGun, Codecademy, CrowdFlower, and Twilio to make it easier for developers to begin using Parse and to integrate with great APIs.-Worked directly with TechCrunch, Fast Company, TheNextWeb and other leading tech publications to get press coverage around our launches and partnerships. Named one of the 100 Most Innovative Companies in the World by Fast Company in 2013.-Managed the Parse blog and wrote all marketing content ranging from customer stories to event recaps. -Created all the website content and worked directly with our designer in the Parse website overhaul so that the content was more easily navigable as well as relevant. -Set up and managed Marketo for profiling and targeting different types of developers and customers using email marketing. Also, Marketo sends all marketing qualified leads into Salesforce for our sales team.-Targeted developers using Facebook ads, Twitter ads, Adwords, Adroll, and LinkedIn ads to generate traffic for events, blogs, and webinars.

recommendations: Nancy Xiao
Product Marketing Manager at Oculus VR
April 23, 2016, Nancy reported directly to Ashley

You can't go wrong with Ashley on your team. She is an impressively skilled marketer and phenomenal manager. She knows how to build great and effective teams, and is one of the most responsive and reliable people I have ever worked with. Ashley can crush any challenge without breaking a sweat, and is extremely good at establishing the greater vision and making it happen quickly and efficiently. She has an amazing grasp of intensely technical material and is brilliant, commanding, and so much fun to work with. You definitely won't want the competition to have her :)
